intro: Tibouchina rupicola, commonly known as the rock heather or rock myrtle, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Tibouchina rupicola is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in landscaping due to its hardiness and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
